meanings.definition: Not able to be acted upon or performed.
meanings.sent2: The heavy rock was unactable for the little child.
meanings.sent3: The unactable door handle made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her unactable fear of heights kept her from climbing the ladder.
meanings.sent5: The unactable knot in the rope was impossible to untangle.

meanings.definition: Not suitable for being acted upon or performed.
meanings.sent2: The wet paint was unactable until it dried.
meanings.sent3: The unactable plan fell apart before it even started.
meanings.sent4: His unactable anger clouded his judgment.
meanings.sent5: The unactable puzzle had missing pieces, making it unsolvable.
